column4: Im new Ubuntu.  I have a problem that never used to happen in vista.  When I write text on a forum, sometimes firefox and the whole Ubuntu stops responding!  Whats going on? I thought Ubuntu was stable?  And how do I get out of it? I had to hard reboot my whole PC?
last question first: yes, switching between operating systems works by rebooting your PC and no other way (except for virtualization, but that's another topic)
which version of Ubuntu are you running? graphics chipset? used driver?
especially proprietary drivers can cause problems
you could have gotten back to your graphical environment by pressing ctrl+f7 btw
again, which version of Ubuntu are you running?
which graphics adapter is in your system?
Ubuntu 9.10.  Laptop with Nvidia 8400 built in
which graphics driver are you using? the proprietary one from nvidia?
i just installed Ubuntu 6 hours ago.. whatever came with it
why would the video driver cause ubuntu to crash just by typing text on a forum?
you were most likely asked whether you want to enable a proprietary driver
no i wasnyt
did you install all available updates yet (through update manager)?
fully up to date
there was 240MB updates after I installed
should I activate nvidia 185 drivers?
if it isn't activated you could give it a try, yes
if it is activated, try deactivating it
you think installing this 185 Nvidia driver will stop the freezing and lockups?
I can't tell for sure, but it's worth a try :)
